overview: Catatonik is a multi sensory installation project which becomes part of my final study for the course design for social change. Originally a study on coal mining it grew as a study of perception and sensitization of a place very few have been to physically but have a vast socio economic and humanitarian implication. The audio-visual nature of this project lets experience one such interpretation which goes against the stereotypical description of a space,like such, a coal mine.  The ethnographic reconstruction of the space happened entirely on a completely different fabric of reality. The installation was entirely made in the campus of Djad both the recording of the audio, video and its related textures.
title: Catatonik
